alert.note: Alert for Chambers (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:50PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Chambers County through 515 PM CDT... At 450 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Veasey Creek Park, or 7 miles east of Stroud, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lakeview, Amity Park, Fredonia, Post Oak Forks, Veasey Creek Park, Standing Rock, Southern Harbor, Stroud Creek and Rocky Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
